result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey K Yost was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
Huber privileges for work.
Consecutive to:

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges including: supervision fees, and DNA surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

No contact with firearms.
Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after this conviction.
No contact with Katherine Y., S.D.E., or J.K.E., unless approved by agent or our court, except for in Family Court, or office of attorney for Katherine Y. to facilitate divorce ONLY.

A course in anger management.
Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment (Can use project retrun assessment).

timeConds.notes: as to each count, STAYED pending review on 10-31-14

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffrey K Yost

records.addlTxt: Received & Filed, Original SENTENCING Transcript (17 pages) commencing 07/02/2014 by Donna Lendowski.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jeffrey K Yost in court with attorney William J. Reddin.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Jeffrey K Yost in court with attorney William J Reddin.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing Proceeded.  Statements by parties and defendant.
AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to 75 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive, with credit for 3 DAYS time served, with Huber privileges for work.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 12 MONTHS.

AS TO COUNT 2
The court sentenced the defendant to 75 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive, with Huber privileges for work.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 12 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Serve 15 DAYS as to each count in the House of Correction as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-A course in anger management.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment (Can use project retrun assessment).
-Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No contact with Katherine Y., S.D.E., or J.K.E., unless approved by agent or our court, except for in Family court, or office of attorney for Katherine Y. to facilitate divorce ONLY.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-Obtain GED/HSED.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges including: supervision fees, and DNA surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief. 
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER
*Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after this conviction.

Filed: 
-Pretrial Sentence Credit
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
-Memorandum of Conditions of Probation  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for October 31, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
CORRECTION: Plea entry of 5/16/2014 reflects corrected information as to firearm prohibition.
Received & Filed, Justice Point VIOLATION Report: Missed Office Contact.

Case Recalled. 
AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2 PER AMENDED INFORMATION
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER. Court advised due to these convictions the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession/use under federal law. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Sentencing.

Defendant Jeffrey K Yost in court with attorney William J Reddin.  Cynthia M Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Final Pretrial. Parties have reached a resolution. 
Received & Filed, Amended Information.
AS TO COUNT 1 
On motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 1 amended to: 
COUNT 1: Disorderly Conduct, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 947.01(1), 939.51(3)(b), a Class B Misdemeanor.
COUNT 2: Disorderly Conduct, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 947.01(1), 939.51(3)(b), a Class B Misdemeanor.
Discussion as to plea negotiations. Case passed to allow defendant and defense counsel to further consult regarding negotiations.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Received & Filed, Documents from the defense as to Sentencing.

Defendant Jeffrey K Yost in court with attorney William J Reddin.  Cynthia M Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial to branch 23.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jeffrey K Yost in court with attorney William J. Reddin.  Matthew G. Puthukulam for Cynthia Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver, received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial before Judge Grady, Branch 23. Original Information, received and filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant plead not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 23.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription AND no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with SDE (4/8/96), KATHERINE Y., JKE (6/1/00), MARGARET E. AND DENNIS W.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jeffrey K Yost in court with attorney Vincent Guimont.  Defendant Jeffrey K Yost in custody.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge GRADY, Branch  23.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.   Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 23.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 12, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
